Description: Landscape with a large ruin and the Temptation of St Antony; the saint kneels before a crucifix and a monkey-like creature farts in his direction; at r, a shrouded figure is accompanied by a collection of monsters, one carrying a ladder; at left, a beggar with a wooden leg and a finely dressed lady approach; in the sky monsters carry off and torment the saint Woodcut
Producer name: Print made by: Jan Wellens de Cock
Curator's comments: See E.S.Jacobowitz and S.L. Stepanek, 'Lucas van Leyden and his contemporaries', National Gallery of Art, Washington, ex. cat. 1983, no. 107. The print was formerly attributed to Hieronymus Bosch (see Passavant, Wurzbach etc). See also E,7.51 for another impression.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
